title.native: 名探偵コナン 黒鉄の魚影

description:
This time's location is set in the sea near the Hachijo-jima island, Tokyo. Engineers from around the world have gathered for the full-scale operation of "Pacific Buoy," an offshore facility to connect security cameras owned by the worldwide police forces. A test of a certain "new technology" based on a face recognition system is underway there.

Meanwhile, Conan and the Detective Boys visit Hachijo-jima at Sonoko's invitation and receive a phone call from Subaru Okiya (a graduate student in the Graduate School of Engineering at Tokyo Metropolitan University, who is an FBI agent Shuichi Akai and a black-robed organization's Rye) informing them that a Europol employee was murdered in Germany by the Black Organization's Jin.

Conan, who is disquieted, sneaks into the facility and finds that a female engineer has been kidnapped by the Black Organization...! Furthermore, a USB drive containing certain information in her possession ends up in the hands of the organization... A black shadow also creeps up on Ai Haibara (Detective Boys' Ai Haibara / Shiho Miyano / the Black Organization's Sherry),..

(Source: Crunchyroll)
hashtag: #劇場版名探偵コナン #黒鉄の魚影
synonyms: 名探偵コナン 黒鉄の魚影（サブマリン）
Detective Conan The Movie: Black Iron Submarine
Thám Tử Lừng Danh Conan: Tàu Ngầm Sắt Màu Đen

tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

name.native: ジョディ・スターリング
ジェイムズ・ブラック

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/usagi_rakuda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/立川譲)

After graduating from university in 2007, Tachikawa joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he debuted as an episode director on [Kiba](https://anilist.co/anime/845/)'s final episode. After this he went freelance.

Some years later in 2013, Tachikawa created, wrote and directed [Death Billiards](https://anilist.co/anime/14353/), a short film produced by Madhouse as part of Young Animator Training Project's; Anime Mirai, a project which funds young creators and animators. Two years later, Tachikawa got to turn the idea into a 12-episode TV series titled [Death Parade](https://anilist.co/anime/20931/).

He has since gone on to direct works such as [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/) and [Detective Conan: Zero the Enforcer](https://anilist.co/anime/100653/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/usagi_rakuda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/立川譲)

After graduating from university in 2007, Tachikawa joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he debuted as an episode director on [Kiba](https://anilist.co/anime/845/)'s final episode. After this he went freelance.

Some years later in 2013, Tachikawa created, wrote and directed [Death Billiards](https://anilist.co/anime/14353/), a short film produced by Madhouse as part of Young Animator Training Project's; Anime Mirai, a project which funds young creators and animators. Two years later, Tachikawa got to turn the idea into a 12-episode TV series titled [Death Parade](https://anilist.co/anime/20931/).

He has since gone on to direct works such as [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/) and [Detective Conan: Zero the Enforcer](https://anilist.co/anime/100653/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1178607902522654720)

Originating from Ad Cosmo. Frequent presence in the [Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/2581/) franchise since 2007.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bleucalire) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bleu_calire/) | [Website](https://clairelaunay.carbonmade.com/)

A French Animator working at [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
